name: Debt Overload
title: Highest Short-term Debt as a Percentage of Total Reserves
description: In 2023, Zimbabwe's short-term debt reached 3409.70% of its total reserves, the highest in the world, indicating a significant financial burden.

name: Skyrocketing Inflation
title: Highest Inflation Rate in the World
description: Zimbabwe's inflation rate, measured by the GDP deflator, soared to 921.54% in 2023, marking the highest globally and reflecting severe economic instability.

name: Interest Rate Rollercoaster
title: Highest Lending Interest Rate
description: In 2023, Zimbabwe's lending interest rate was 170.29%, the highest worldwide, creating a challenging environment for borrowing and investment.

name: Negative Wealth Growth
title: Lowest Net Foreign Assets
description: Zimbabwe's net foreign assets stood at -18.86 trillion LCU in 2023, the lowest globally, indicating a significant outflow of capital.

name: Economic Growth Mirage
title: High Adjusted Net National Income Growth
description: In 2021, Zimbabwe experienced a 38.98% growth in adjusted net national income, suggesting potential economic recovery despite underlying challenges.

name: Social Safety Net
title: Significant Social Protection Benefits to the Poorest
description: In 2019, 37.55% of Zimbabwe's social protection benefits were directed to the poorest quintile, highlighting efforts to support vulnerable populations.

name: Healthcare Cost Burden
title: Low Impact of Healthcare Costs on Poverty
description: In 2017, only 1.82% of Zimbabwe's population was pushed further below the poverty line due to healthcare costs, indicating relatively low financial strain from medical expenses.

name: Manufacturing Tariff Complexity
title: Moderate Tariff Specificity in Manufacturing
description: In 2016, 5.94% of Zimbabwe's tariff lines for manufactured products had specific rates, reflecting a moderate level of tariff complexity.
